alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 1:06PM MST until August 07 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 100 PM MST, Emergency management reported flash flooding due to thunderstorms over the Pipeline Burn Scar. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. Doppler radar has indicated that the heaviest rain has moved away from the burn scar, however, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly as water drains off the scar. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff. This includes the following highways... Highway 180 between mile markers 218 and 220. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain.
